answerText: Foucault's pendulum[10] A regular pendulum can be considered simple harmonic motion if one makes this assumption, in which the Taylor series of trigonometric functions are truncated. Using it, sine of theta is replaced with theta.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Schindler + Yale C + Minnesota B | 19 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This device is an example of a system that exhibits the Hannay angle, the classical analog to the Berry phase. For 10 points each: [10] Identify this device used as a simple demonstration of the rotation of the Earth.
